Description:
COUNTRY ATMOSPHERE - URBAN CONVENIENCE
Hidden amid an established native garden setting in the green surrounds of Croydon North, sits this surprising and appealing older home with flexible floor plan, on a massive old-school 1586m2 (approx).
Blocks this size are becoming ever more scarce in this small pocket, highly sought after for its mix of bush charm, affordability and urban convenience.
Your first view up the driveway is of the fabulous outdoor covered fernery/ BBQ area. Entry from the feature cedar door to an enormous L shaped living area with feature brick wall. Beyond is a cooks kitchen with a full 3 metres of open bench space! Let your inner Masterchef loose, with quality St George appliances, dishwasher and generous fridge provision completing this super workspace. Adjacent is the informal slate floored dining, which opens direct to the BBQ area, for easy informal entertaining.
The three bedroom all have built-in robes, with the master enjoying a full en-suite. A good sized family bathroom services the other bedrooms. The study (or nursery/4th bedroom), has access to a second outdoor area; an elevated but very private covered front patio with spa. Direct access to the patio is available via the master also, making this area an ideal space for mum and dad to enjoy, with fantastic views by day and the lights of the Ranges by night. This is set over a double lock up garage and spacious workshop with hot and cold water plumbed in and generous under-house storage, (perfect for that wine collection). An extra carport provides easy access to the home and there is even more off street parking for the trade vehicle, guests or the multi-car family. Gas central heating and evaporative cooling take care of the winter and summer extremes.
Enjoy bushwalking in the nearby Flora Reserve while having the the Exeter Road shopping strip, complete with Supermarket, Pharmacy, caf and hairdressing just minutes away, or choose between the Chirnside Park or Ringwood Shopping complexes. Add to the list; easy freeway access, Luther And Oxley Colleges close by, and bus service to Croydon Station 100 metres away. All of this, and the attractions of the Yarra Valley wineries, cafes and galleries close enough for easy, lazy weekend Brunches and shopping.
Endless possibilities present for this property, with the solid bones of the current, very liveable home suited to renovation alone, or add another level (STCA) to create a truly enormous family retreat and capture those mountain views. Strong subdivision potential adds yet another attraction, with room to spare for an additional dwelling. So many opportunities are here for the savvy purchaser. Highly recommended.
